update.description:
This PR adds logging plugin for recording and playback.

Recording uses ign-transport messages, currently only poses are recorded \(\`/world/default/pose/info\` topic\).

* Currently SDF file is dumped to a separate text file. Later, this will need to be published on another ign-transport topic, to be recorded together with the serialized ECM.

Playback loads the `.tlog` file using ign-transport `Log.hh`. When the timestamp from world startup reaches the recorded timestamp minus recording startup, the current model poses are overwritten by the recorded ones.

* Currently only `Model` poses are played back, not `Link`, because for links with the same name but belonging to different models, there’s no way from the ign-transport messages to tell which model the link belonged to.  
  This should be resolved once we replace the pose topic with the topic with serialized ECM.

Example SDF files and a keyboard example for controlling the two vehicles are included for testing out the plugins.

## Testing

### Recording

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/standalone/keyboard/build`

`./keyboard ../keyboard.sdf`

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/worlds`

`ign-gazebo -v 4 -f log_record.sdf -r`

Use arrow keys and ASDW to move the vehicles somewhere.

### Playback

`ign-gazebo -f empty.sdf -v 4`

Physics must be off.

Fixed. **~~Intermittent bug~~**~~: Sometimes nothing is loaded into the world. Might have to do with how the SDF is loaded? Currently it's loaded using these two lines in~~ `Configure()`~~:~~

`ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator creator = ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator(_ecm, _eventMgr);`  
`creator.CreateEntities(sdf_world);`

~~Also tried putting~~ `CreateEntities()` ~~in~~ `PreUpdate()` ~~instead of~~ `Configure()`~~, in case GUI might see them as new entities. Issue persists.~~

## Next steps

Upon PR #175 completion, replace the topic used in recording and playback with the topic with serialized ECM, as well as an additional topic for the SDF string, published once at startup.
update.title: [Acropolis-patch] Add logging

content.raw: Sounds good
content.html: Sounds good

content.raw: May I propose that we hold off on this PR until next week? There is nothing in here that will prevent us from make a patch release of ign-gazebo.
content.html: May I propose that we hold off on this PR until next week? There is nothing in here that will prevent us from make a patch release of ign-gazebo.

content.raw: Actually I was just suggesting we use sim time instead of relying on the start wall time
content.html: Actually I was just suggesting we use sim time instead of relying on the start wall time

content.raw: Fixed in 5791925
content.html: Fixed in 5791925

content.raw: Fixed in ca898f2
content.html: Fixed in ca898f2

content.raw: I think it would be better to get the current sim time from `_info` instead of relying on wall time. This way we can make sure other systems are in sync and that pausing works. We'll need to compare that sim time to the pose message's timestamp.
content.html: I think it would be better to get the current sim time from _info instead of relying on wall time. This way we can make sure other systems are in sync and that pausing works. We'll need to compare that sim time to the pose message's timestamp.

content.raw: Just checking, this documentation is outdated, right?
content.html: Just checking, this documentation is outdated, right?

content.raw: We should also use `ignition::common::Filesystem`, since some platforms don't have great `sdf::filesystem` support yet
content.html: We should also use ignition::common::Filesystem, since some platforms don't have great sdf::filesystem support yet

content.raw: Another thing to consider is that we don't need to store these paths as member variables since they're only used within this function
content.html: Another thing to consider is that we don't need to store these paths as member variables since they're only used within this function

content.raw: I think the current code wouldn't work on Windows. Ignition common has helpers that we can use here to be cross-platform, like `IGN_HOMEDIR` and `joinPaths`.
content.html: I think the current code wouldn't work on Windows. Ignition common has helpers that we can use here to be cross-platform, like IGN_HOMEDIR and joinPaths.

content.raw:
With the current logic, if the user specifies one but not the other, we'll override the one the user defined.

How do you feel about letting the user specify a single directory path that we then use it for both files, with predefined file names?
content.html:
With the current logic, if the user specifies one but not the other, we'll override the one the user defined.

How do you feel about letting the user specify a single directory path that we then use it for both files, with predefined file names?

content.raw: I suspect this is the cause of the occasional empty scene. I did some debugging and that issue happens when `this->worldEntity ==1`, but not when `this->worldEntity == 3` in `SceneBroadcaster`.
content.html: I suspect this is the cause of the occasional empty scene. I did some debugging and that issue happens when this->worldEntity ==1, but not when this->worldEntity == 3 in SceneBroadcaster.

This PR adds logging plugin for recording and playback.

Recording uses ign-transport messages, currently only poses are recorded \(\`/world/default/pose/info\` topic\).

* Currently SDF file is dumped to a separate text file. Later, this will need to be published on another ign-transport topic, to be recorded together with the serialized ECM.

Playback loads the `.tlog` file using ign-transport `Log.hh`. When the timestamp from world startup reaches the recorded timestamp minus recording startup, the current model poses are overwritten by the recorded ones.

* Currently only `Model` poses are played back, not `Link`, because for links with the same name but belonging to different models, there’s no way from the ign-transport messages to tell which model the link belonged to.  
  This should be resolved once we replace the pose topic with the topic with serialized ECM.

Example SDF files and a keyboard example for controlling the two vehicles are included for testing out the plugins.

## Testing

### Recording

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/standalone/keyboard/build`

`./keyboard ../keyboard.sdf`

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/worlds`

`ign-gazebo -v 4 -f log_record.sdf -r`

Use arrow keys and ASDW to move the vehicles somewhere.

### Playback

`ign-gazebo -f empty.sdf -v 4`

Physics must be off.

**Intermittent bug**: Sometimes nothing is loaded into the world. Might have to do with how the SDF is loaded? Currently it's loaded using these two lines in `Configure()`:

`ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator creator = ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator(_ecm, _eventMgr);`  
`creator.CreateEntities(sdf_world);`

Also tried putting `CreateEntities()` in `PreUpdate()` instead of `Configure()`, in case GUI might see them as new entities. Issue persists.

## Next steps

Upon PR #175 completion, replace the topic used in recording and playback with the topic with serialized ECM, as well as an additional topic for the SDF string, published once at startup.
update.title: [A-4] Add logging

update.title: [A-4] Add logging

content.raw:
This function is creating a new entity for the world and creating all the models as children of that world. So we end up with 2 world entities, one which loaded this plugin (the `Entity` received in `Configure`), and the new one.

I _think_ this is now causing any problems right now, but there will be a disconnect between the plugins loaded together with `LogPlayback` at startup and the plugins loaded from the recorded file, so we probably want to avoid creating a new world entity here.
content.html:
This function is creating a new entity for the world and creating all the models as children of that world. So we end up with 2 world entities, one which loaded this plugin (the Entity received in Configure), and the new one.

I think this is now causing any problems right now, but there will be a disconnect between the plugins loaded together with LogPlayback at startup and the plugins loaded from the recorded file, so we probably want to avoid creating a new world entity here.

content.raw: Another idea would be to generate a unique name for the file instead of failing. See [gazebo::common::unique_file_path](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/gazebo/common/CommonIface.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#CommonIface.cc-130) for example; it would be nice to port that function to `ignition::common::Filesystem`, or we could just copy it here temporarily to be quicker.
content.html: Another idea would be to generate a unique name for the file instead of failing. See gazebo::common::unique_file_path for example; it would be nice to port that function to ignition::common::Filesystem, or we could just copy it here temporarily to be quicker.

content.raw: How about having a default path where logs are saved to in case the path is not set by the user? On Gazebo 9, logs end up under `~/.gazebo/log/<timestamp>` by default. We could use `~/.ignition/gazebo/log/<timestamp>` here.
content.html: How about having a default path where logs are saved to in case the path is not set by the user? On Gazebo 9, logs end up under ~/.gazebo/log/<timestamp> by default. We could use ~/.ignition/gazebo/log/<timestamp> here.
